text: André Jolivet wrote his first Flute Concerto in 1949. It is scored for solo flute and stringsBlakeman, Edward (1990), La Flûte Enchantée, (Chandos Records), CHAN 8840, liner notes.New World Symphony, Concerto Showcase, Program Notes by Aaron Grad, January 2015. and was premièred on 24 January 1950 by soloist Jean-Pierre Rampal.IRCAM data sheet The work lasts about 13 minutes. It is now part of the standard flute repertoire and several prominent flautists have recorded it.Sarah Louvion: Œuvres pour flûte de Jolivet, Bauzin, Roussel, Ibert - Farao Classics CD (2008) - liner notes "... the concerto for flute and strings by André Jolivet composed in 1949, commissioned by Jean-Pierre Rampal and now part of the repertoire established for flute". Musicweb-international.com CD Review, Les Rarissimes de André Jolivet, Hubert Culot, 2004. ==Background== Jolivet associated the sound of the flute with "the breath of life" and was particularly fascinated by its "primitive" connotations.Musicweb-international.com CD Review, Dominy Clements In 1944, he wrote Chant de Linos for a competition at the Paris Conservatoire. Jean-Pierre Rampal won the First Prize and he and Jolivet became close friends. Five years later, the composer wrote the Flute Concerto for Rampal. ==Overview== The concerto is cast in four short movements that follow a slow-fast-slow-fast structure reminiscent of the 17th-century Italian sonata da chiesa. Although tonally adventurous,Musicweb-international CD Review, Brian Reinhart the work is notable for its melodic simplicity and lack of gratuitous virtuosity, which sets it apart from the Romantic tradition of showy concertos. The piece starts with a soft, melancholy melody but gets more and more agitated and dissonant as the strings enter, although some brighter passages still appear occasionally. After the dark slow movement the work ends with an Allegro risoluto and a propulsive, thrilling finale.Allmusic.com Work Description, Chris Morrison As critic Antoine Goléa remarked: ==Movements== # Andante cantabile # Allegro scherzando # Largo # Allegro risoluto == Recordings == * Jean-Pierre Rampal (flute) - Orchestre Lamoureux - Conductor: André Jolivet - Recorded in 1966, Warner - Erato 2564 61320-2 (2004). * Alexander Korneev (flute) - Moscow Radio Symphony Orchestra - Conductor: André Jolivet, Melodia D-017-995-8 (1966). * Aurèle Nicolet (flute) - Orchestre Régional Provence Côte d’Azur - Conductor: Philippe Bender, Lyrinx 8211/029 (1983). * Susan Milan (flute) - City of London Sinfonia - Conductor: Richard Hickox, Chandos Records CHAN 8840 (1989). * Petri Alanko (flute) - Finnish Radio Symphony Orchestra - Conductor: Jukka-Pekka Saraste, Ondine Records - ODE 802-2 (1993). * Manuela Wiesler (flute) - Tapiola Sinfonietta - Conductor: Paavo Järvi, Bis Records - 739 (1996). * Sarah Louvion (flute) - Ensemble du Festival Flûte- Haubois en Livradois - Conductor: Ariel Zuckermann, Farao Classics - B108032 (2008). ==References== Category:Compositions by André Jolivet Jolivet, Andre, 1 Category:1949 compositions
